In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a possible implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width=10)
    lines = []
    line = ""
    for word in split(str)
        if length(word) + length(line) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        line *= word
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    return lines
end
```
Here is an example of how to use the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
text = "This is a very long text that we want to wrap."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
# Output:
# This
# is
# a
# very
# long
# text
# that
# we
# want
# to
# wrap.
```
